com.mendeley.api.auth

Class AuthenticationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mendeley.api.auth.AuthenticationManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class AuthenticationManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is responsible for authenticating the user, using a WebView to display the authentication web page.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • checkCredentialsAndCopyToNetworkProvider

        public boolean checkCredentialsAndCopyToNetworkProvider()
        Querying the CredentialManager if credentials are already stored on the device.
        Returns:
        true if credentials exists, false otherwise.

      • clearCredentials

        public void clearCredentials()
        Forwarding a call to the AuthenticationManager to clear user credentials from the device.

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate()
        Authenticating the User. If credentials exist already, creating a RefreshHandler for refreshing the access token, otherwise displaying a WebView with the authentication web page, in which the user will have to enter his username and password.

      • setTokenDetails

        public void setTokenDetails(java.lang.String tokenString)
                     throws JSONException
        Extracts the token details from the token string and sends them to the CredentialManager.

        Throws:
